tutorialEntries: Another important part of Java are "Loop Statements"! Similar to "Conditional Statements" they also ask for a <condition>, but they don't differentiate between different courses of action and will perform the specified course of action for as long as the <condition> is met instead.

We now want to add an if-Statement into our while-Statement that checks the following conditions:
<knight name>.canMove()	(which tests whether our knight can move)
<knight name>.targetCellIs(EXIT)
Can you already solve this puzzle without checking the next message?
